name: vim
description: Vim emulation for Visual Studio Code

keybindings.when: editorTextFocus && vim.active && vim.use<C-m> && !inDebugRepl || vim.mode == 'CommandlineInProgress' && vim.active && vim.use<C-m> && !inDebugRepl || vim.mode == 'SearchInProgressMode' && vim.active && vim.use<C-m> && !inDebugRepl

editorTextFocus && vim.active && vim.use<C-n> && !inDebugRepl || vim.mode == 'CommandlineInProgress' && vim.active && vim.use<C-n> && !inDebugRepl || vim.mode == 'SearchInProgressMode' && vim.active && vim.use<C-n> && !inDebugRepl

suggestWidgetVisible && vim.active && vim.use<C-p> && !inDebugRepl || vim.mode == 'CommandlineInProgress' && vim.active && vim.use<C-p> && !inDebugRepl || vim.mode == 'SearchInProgressMode' && vim.active && vim.use<C-p> && !inDebugRepl

editorTextFocus && vim.active && vim.use<D-v> && vim.mode == 'CommandlineInProgress' && !inDebugRepl || editorTextFocus && vim.active && vim.use<D-v> && vim.mode == 'SearchInProgressMode' && !inDebugRepl
vim.mode == 'Normal' && editorTextFocus && inputFocus && notebookEditorFocused && notebookEditorCursorAtBoundary != 'none' && notebookEditorCursorAtBoundary != 'top'
vim.mode == 'Normal' && editorTextFocus && inputFocus && notebookEditorFocused && notebookEditorCursorAtBoundary != 'bottom' && notebookEditorCursorAtBoundary != 'none'

vim.debug.silent.description: If true, all logs are suppressed.

vim.debug.loggingLevelForAlert.description: Maximum level of messages to present as VS Code information window.

vim.debug.loggingLevelForConsole.description: Maximum level of messages to log to console. Logs are visible in developer tools.

vim.normalModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in Normal mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.normalModeKeyBindingsNonRecursive.markdownDescription: Non-recursive remapped keys in Normal mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.operatorPendingModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in OperatorPending mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.operatorPendingModeKeyBindingsNonRec.markdownDescription: Non-recursive remapped keys in OperatorPending mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.useCtrlKeys.markdownDescription: Enable some Vim Ctrl key commands that override otherwise common operations, like `Ctrl+C`.

vim.leader.markdownDescription: What key should `<leader>` map to in remappings?

vim.searchHighlightColor.markdownDescription: Background color of non-current search matches. The color must not be opaque so as not to hide underlying decorations. Uses `#editor.findMatchHighlightColor#` from current theme if undefined.

vim.searchHighlightTextColor.markdownDescription: Foreground color of non-current search matches.

vim.searchMatchColor.markdownDescription: Background color of the current match. Uses `#editor.findMatchColor#` from current theme if undefined.

vim.searchMatchTextColor.markdownDescription: Foreground color of the current match.

vim.substitutionColor.markdownDescription: Background color of substituted text when `#editor.inccommand#` is enabled. Uses `#editor.findMatchColor#` from current theme if undefined.

vim.substitutionTextColor.markdownDescription: Foreground color of substituted text when `#editor.inccommand#` is enabled.

vim.highlightedyank.color.description: Background color of yanked text. The color must not be opaque so as not to hide underlying decorations.

vim.highlightedyank.duration.description: Duration in milliseconds of the yank highlight.

vim.useSystemClipboard.description: Use system clipboard for unnamed register.

vim.overrideCopy.description: Override VS Code's copy command with our own copy command, which works better with VSCodeVim. Turn this off if copying is not working.

vim.insertModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in Insert mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.insertModeKeyBindingsNonRecursive.markdownDescription: Non-recursive keybinding overrides to use for Insert mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.visualModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in Visual mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.visualModeKeyBindingsNonRecursive.markdownDescription: Non-recursive keybinding overrides to use for Visual mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.commandLineModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in command line mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.commandLineModeKeyBindingsNonRecursi.markdownDescription: Non-recursive keybinding overrides to use for command line mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.textwidth.markdownDescription: Width to word-wrap to when using `gq`.

vim.timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for remapped commands.

vim.maxmapdepth.description: Maximum number of times a mapping is done without resulting in a character to be used.

vim.scroll.markdownDescription: Number of lines to scroll with `Ctrl-U` and `Ctrl-D` commands. Set to 0 to use a half page scroll.

vim.showcmd.description: Show the text of any command you are in the middle of writing.

vim.showmodename.description: Show the name of the current mode in the statusbar.

vim.iskeyword.markdownDescription: Keywords contain alphanumeric characters and '_'. If not configured, `#editor.wordSeparators#` is used.

vim.smartcase.markdownDescription: Override the `ignorecase` option if the search pattern contains upper case characters.

vim.matchpairs.markdownDescription: Characters that form pairs. The % command jumps from one to the other. Only character pairs are allowed that are different, thus you cannot jump between two double quotes. The characters must be separated by a colon. The pairs must be separated by a comma.

vim.easymotionMarkerBackgroundColor.description: Set a custom background color for EasyMotion markers.

vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorOneCh.description: Set a custom color for the text on one character long markers.

vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCh.description: Set a custom color for the text on two character long markers.
vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCh.markdownDeprecationMessage: **Deprecated**: Please don't use this setting, use `#vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCharFirst#` and `#vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCharSecond#` instead.
vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCh.deprecationMessage: Deprecated: Please don't use this setting, use `#vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCharFirst#` and `#vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCharSecond#` instead.

vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCh.description: Set a custom color for the first character on two character long markers.
Set a custom color for the second character on two character long markers.

vim.easymotionIncSearchForegroundColor.markdownDescription: Set a custom color for the easymotion search n-character (default `<leader><leader>/`).

vim.easymotionDimColor.markdownDescription: Set a custom color for the easymotion dimmed characters when `#vim.easymotionDimBackground#` is set to true.

vim.easymotionMarkerWidthPerChar.description: Set the width (in pixels) allocated to each character in the match.
vim.easymotionMarkerWidthPerChar.markdownDeprecationMessage: **Deprecated**: Please don't use this setting; the extension now lets vscode calculate the correct width.
vim.easymotionMarkerWidthPerChar.deprecationMessage: Deprecated: Please don't use this setting; the extension now lets vscode calculate the correct width.

vim.easymotionDimBackground.description: Whether to dim other text while markers are visible.

vim.easymotionMarkerFontFamily.description: Set the font family of the marker text.
vim.easymotionMarkerFontFamily.markdownDeprecationMessage: **Deprecated**: Please don't use this setting; the extension now uses `#editor.fontFamily#` instead.
vim.easymotionMarkerFontFamily.deprecationMessage: Deprecated: Please don't use this setting; the extension now uses editor.fontFamily instead.

vim.easymotionMarkerFontSize.description: Set the font size of the marker text.
vim.easymotionMarkerFontSize.markdownDeprecationMessage: **Deprecated**: Please don't use this setting; the extension now uses `#editor.fontSize#` instead.
vim.easymotionMarkerFontSize.deprecationMessage: Deprecated: Please don't use this setting; the extension now uses editor.fontSize instead.

vim.easymotionMarkerFontWeight.description: Set the font weight of the marker text.

vim.easymotionMarkerMargin.description: Set the margin around each marker, in pixels.
vim.easymotionMarkerMargin.markdownDeprecationMessage: **Deprecated**: Please don't use this setting, it is no longer required.
vim.easymotionMarkerMargin.deprecationMessage: Deprecated: Please don't use this setting, it is no longer required.

vim.easymotionKeys.description: Set the characters used for jump marker name.

vim.smartRelativeLine.markdownDescription: `#editor.lineNumbers#` is determined by the active Vim mode, absolute when in insert mode, relative otherwise.

vim.sneakUseIgnorecaseAndSmartcase.markdownDescription: Case sensitivity is determined by `#vim.ignorecase#` and `#vim.smartcase#`.

vim.sneakReplacesF.markdownDescription: Use single-character [Sneak](https://github.com/justinmk/vim-sneak) instead of Vim's native `f`.

vim.argumentObjectSeparators.markdownDescription: Set separators for the argument text object.

vim.argumentObjectOpeningDelimiters.markdownDescription: Set opening delimiters for the argument text object.

vim.argumentObjectClosingDelimiters.markdownDescription: Set closing delimiters for the argument text object.

vim.hlsearch.description: Show all matches of the most recent search pattern.

vim.inccommand.markdownDescription: Show the effects of the `:substitute` command as you type.

vim.incsearch.markdownDescription: Show where a `/` or `?` search matches as you type it.

vim.history.description: How much search or command history should be remembered.

vim.joinspaces.description: Add two spaces after '.', '?', and '!' when joining or reformatting.

vim.handleKeys.description: Delegate certain key combinations back to VSCode to be handled natively.

vim.statusBarColorControl.markdownDescription: Allow VSCodeVim to change status bar color based on mode. **NOTE:** Using this feature will have a negative impact on performance.

vim.statusBarColors.normal.description: Status bar color when in Normal mode.

vim.statusBarColors.insert.description: Status bar color when in Insert mode.

vim.statusBarColors.visual.description: Status bar color when in Visual mode.

vim.statusBarColors.visualline.description: Status bar color when in VisualLine mode.

vim.statusBarColors.visualblock.description: Status bar color when in VisualBlock mode.

vim.statusBarColors.replace.description: Status bar color when in Replace mode.

vim.statusBarColors.commandlineinprogres.description: Status bar color when in CommandLineInProgress mode.

vim.statusBarColors.searchinprogressmode.description: Status bar color when in SearchInProgress mode.

vim.statusBarColors.easymotionmode.description: Status bar color when in EasyMotion mode.

vim.statusBarColors.easymotioninputmode.description: Status bar color when in EasyMotionInput mode.

vim.statusBarColors.surroundinputmode.description: Status bar color when in SurroundInput mode.

vim.visualstar.markdownDescription: In Visual mode, start a search with `*` or `#` using the current selection.

vim.changeWordIncludesWhitespace.description: Includes trailing whitespace when changing word.

vim.foldfix.description: Uses a hack to move around folds properly.

vim.mouseSelectionGoesIntoVisualMode.description: If enabled, dragging with the mouse activates Visual mode.

vim.disableExtension.description: Disables the VSCodeVim extension. The extension will continue to be loaded and activated, but Vim functionality will be disabled.

vim.enableNeovim.markdownDescription: Use Neovim to execute Ex commands. You should restart VS Code after enabling/disabling this for the changes to take effect. **NOTE:** Neovim version 0.2.0 or greater must be installed, and if the executable is not on your PATH, `#vim.neovimPath#` must be set.

vim.neovimPath.markdownDescription: Path to Neovim executable. For example, `/usr/bin/nvim`, or  `C:\Program Files\Neovim\bin\nvim.exe`.

vim.neovimUseConfigFile.markdownDescription: Use a config file for Neovim, specified by `vim.neovimConfigPath`.

vim.neovimConfigPath.markdownDescription: Path to Neovim configuration file. `vim.neovimUseConfigFile` must be enabled. If path is left blank, Neovim will use its default config path, i.e. `~/.config/nvim/init.vim` or 'C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Local\nvim\init.vim'.

vim.vimrc.enable.markdownDescription: Use key mappings from a `.vimrc` file.

vim.vimrc.path.markdownDescription: Path to a Vim configuration file. If unset, it will check for `$HOME/.vimrc`, `$HOME/_vimrc`, and `$HOME/.config/nvim/init.vim`, in that order.

vim.substituteGlobalFlag.markdownDescription: Automatically apply the global flag, `/g`, to substitute commands. When set to true, use `/g` to mean only first match should be replaced.

vim.gdefault.markdownDescription: Automatically apply the global flag, `/g`, to substitute commands. When set to true, use `/g` to mean only first match should be replaced.

vim.autoSwitchInputMethod.enable.description: If enabled, the input method switches automatically when the mode changes.

vim.autoSwitchInputMethod.defaultIM.markdownDescription: The input method for your normal mode, find more information [here](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim#input-method).

vim.autoSwitchInputMethod.switchIMCmd.description: The shell command to switch input method.

vim.autoSwitchInputMethod.obtainIMCmd.description: The shell command to get current input method.

vim.whichwrap.description: Comma-separated list of motion keys that should wrap to next/previous line.

vim.report.description: Threshold for reporting number of lines changed.

vim.digraphs.description: Custom digraph shortcuts for inserting special characters, expressed as UTF16 code points.

vim.wrapscan.description: Searches wrap around the end of the file.

vim.startofline.markdownDescription: When `true` the commands listed below move the cursor to the first non-blank of the line.  When `false` the cursor is kept in the same column (if possible).  This applies to the commands: `<C-d>`, `<C-u>`, `<C-b>`, `<C-f>`, `G`, `H`, `M`, `L`, `gg`, and to the commands `d`, `<<` and `>>` with a linewise operator.

vim.showMarksInGutter.description: Show the currently set mark(s) in the gutter.

vim.shell.description: Path to the shell to use for `!` and `:!` commands.
